metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18389 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer overflow in the vrend_renderer_transfer_write_iovfunction in vrend_renderer.c in virglrenderer through 0.8.0 allows guest OSusers to cause a denial of service, or QEMU guest-to-host escape and codeexecution, via VIRGL_CCMD_RESOURCE_INLINE_WRITE commands.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18389` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvirglrenderer1 - 0.8.1-6
virgl-server - 0.8.1-6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virglrenderer package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.1-6').
